content.description: <math alttext="Uranium-238 with atomic number 92 produces thorium-234 with atomic number 90 plus X plus gamma"><mstyle><mrow><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>U</mtext></mrow><mprescripts><mrow><mn>92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>238</mn></mrow></mprescripts></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mtext>Th</mtext></mrow><mprescripts><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mprescripts></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mi>X</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>γ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following predictions is correct about the identity of product <math alttext="X"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is created by the nuclear process shown?

choices.label: A <math alttext="beta with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> particle

A <math alttext="beta with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> particle

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
